result.execSummary:
The defendant Cindy S. Geoffrey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Writings or Objects, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1)(a).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Transfer (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant ordered to have a Mental Health Assessment/Psychological Evaluation and to comply with any recommended treatment.

No contact with Mills Fleet Farm store.
Comply with any other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the Department of Corrections.
Sign release of information forms for offenders assessmentd, medication/pharmacy(ies) and/or treatment. 
List of all prescriptions and signed releases for Agent to monitor.   
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.    
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.   
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge. 
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.

If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

records.addlTxt:
9:10 a.m. Defendant Cindy S. Geoffrey in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson.  ADA Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received and reviewed PSI report. Atty Halverson provides the Court with a letter from her doctor. Court reviewed. ADA Constable states sentencing recommendation of 7 years prison. Atty Halverson states sentencing recommendation of 5 years probation w/stayed prison sentence. Defendant is currently on probation in Minnesota. 

BTC: ****Prison*****
Count 1: 28 months Incarceration and 36 months  Extended Supervision (credit will be submitted to the court within 30 days), (court will determine by noon today if prison sentence is concurrent or consecutive)
w/conditions as stated in the PSI.
No contact with Mills Fleet Farm store.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.    
Defendant ordered to have a Mental Health Assessment/Psychological Evaluation and to comply with any recommended treatment.   
Comply with any other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the Department of Corrections.
Sign release of information forms for offenders assessmentd, medication/pharmacy(ies) and/or treatment. 
List of all prescriptions and signed releases for Agent to monitor.   
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.    
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.   
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time as medically able.  
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge. 
Pay costs at 25% to restitution first.  
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
Restitution $337.88.

Count 2: 7 months jail, concurrent with count 1. Pay costs.
Bond is revoked.
Defendant is remanded to the Portage County Jail.
Sentencing hearing on July 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Cindy S. Geoffrey in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:06 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Constable states the appearances.

Court questions if a plea had been taken; Atty Constable states that a plea had been taken but sentencing has not been completed.
Atty Halverson makes statements regarding the medical records that had been requested.
Atty Halverson would request to have this set for a sentencing hearing.
Atty Constable would like bond revoked for the defendant and have set for a sentencing hearing on July 14, 2016 at 9:00 a.m.; Atty Constable makes additional statements.
Court questions Atty Halverson if she would be available on the 14th for sentencing.
Atty Halverson responds to the statements of Atty Constable and would request that a sentencing be held at a later date.
Atty Halverson would request that the bond remain as is and schedule sentencing at a later date.

BY THE COURT:
Court will not revoke bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status hearing on July 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant has failed to appear for her sentencing hearing today.
Court received a document from Atty Halverson that had been provided to her from the defendant and this had been provided to the State.
Atty Halverson makes statements as to why her client has failed to appear today.
Atty Constable makes her statements.
Court makes statements.

BY THE COURT:
Defendant to provide an authorization to Atty Halverson to obtain her medical records.
Court will hold off issuing a warrant for her arrest pending her compliance in providing an authorization to Atty Halverson 10 days from today's date.
Case will be scheduled for a Status at a later date.
Parties will contact JA with Branch 2 to obtain a date for a Status Conference.
Sentencing hearing on June 15, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Acalia N Halverson in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:10 a.m.  Court is in session and states the appearances.
Court indicates that a fax was received indicating that the defendant has a medical issue and Sentencing Hearing to be re-scheduled.

The parties have not yet received their copy of the PSI.  Court will make sure they receive their copies.

BY THE COURT:

Defendant Cindy S. Geoffrey in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:44 PM Court calls case. 
Court states appearances. 

Court reviews the file, warrant was issued on March 10th.

Atty Halverson states that this is a voluntary appearance. 

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 2.
State moves to dismiss and read in Count 3 and Count 4.
State will cap its recommendation at 2 years.
Parties request a PSI.

Atty Halverson concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1.
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2.

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Halverson for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Found Guilty
Count 2: Found Guilty
Count 3: Dismissed and Read In
Count 4: Dismissed and Read In

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a PSI be conducted before sentencing.

Atty Constable addresses the Court, Defendant submitted to a PSI in St Croix County for charges over there.
Court concurs, if DOC feels the PSI in St. Croix County is appropriate, that they may utilize it.  

Court asks that Court be provided access to the PSI from St. Croix County and that copies to be forwarded to parties.

Atty Constable replies.

Atty Halverson addresses the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Warrant is quashed. 
Court will reinstate and continue conditions of bond.


  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
